sections.heading: Overview
content:
Bryce C. Williams, MS, is an exercise physiologist specializing in the
prevention and treatment of heart disease and other chronic illnesses. Over the
past several years, Williams has worked with Dean Ornish, MD, at the nonprofit
Preventive Medicine Research Institute (PMRI). He is also working with
Lifestyle Advantage LLC, a joint venture sponsored by PMRI and Highmark Blue
Cross Blue Shield to expand access to the Ornish program. He enjoys lecturing
to groups and at health care systems across the country about the Ornish
program and the benefits of physical activity.

Williams received his graduate degree in exercise physiology from the
University of Wisconsin-La Crosse. His undergraduate studies were conducted at
Southern Methodist University in Dallas. He is a certified exercise specialist
with the American College of Sports Medicine.
